Port scanning is a technique used to uncover internal vulnerabilities on your network or system. It allows you to test the availability of http, ftp, ssh, and other common ports on your network to detect any weaknesses. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to conduct a port scan reconnaissance.
Step 1: Choose Your Scan Targets
The first step in port scanning is to select your scan targets. You can use a variety of services, such as iScanner, Nmap, or Snort, to scan your target system with a comprehensive list of ports.
